results.title: Scenes and songs from Boyd Webb
results.creator_credit: Philip Haas, Boyd Webb, Arts Council of Great Britain and Methodact
results.brief_description: Boyd Webb is usually classified as a sculptor although he does not exhibit three-dimensional objects. His art-works are extremely large photographs. In this film, the artist has designed eight new works specifically for the film camera. They expand on recent photographic pieces which have dealt with the vagaries of life in a post-nuclear era.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Philip Haas, Boyd Webb, Arts Council of Great Britain and Methodact

results.title: People of influence
results.creator_credit: Arch Nicholson, Tom Manefield, John Abbott and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Soviet style”.
The troika, which governs the lives of all working Russians is illustrated. The film shows the relationship between the Director, the Trade Union chairman and the Party secretary of an enterprise. The Director of the enterprise is shown at a coal mine, supervising his men; the Party Secretary’s influence aids the workers in a gravel washing enterprise; a Trade Union Chairman is seen at work at a refrigerator factory and shows her responsibilities. Cameraman, Dean Semler; editors, Tom Foley, Wayne Le Clos.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Arch Nicholson, Tom Manefield, John Abbott and Film Australia

results.title: When the war came to Australia
results.creator_credit: Peter Butt, Bee Reynolds, Will Davies and Look Television Productions
results.brief_description: A four-part series which looks at world war two from the point of view of ordinary Australians. Australians who either took part in the war or observed it from home, talk about their experiences in between archival footage and narrated commentary.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Peter Butt, Bee Reynolds, Will Davies and Look Television Productions

results.title: The Long war
results.creator_credit: Peter Butt, Bee Reynolds, Will Davies and Look Television Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “When the war came to Australia”.
In this final episode, Australians must face the consequences of over six years of war - a toll of shattered limbs, lives and unrealised dreams. After victory in the Pacific, it is a weary nation that welcomes its soldiers home. The war years have changed for ever the way Australians see themselves, both individually, particularly with respect to the relationships between the sexes, and as a nation looking to America and Asia instead of to Britain. Individuals comment on what the war meant to the average Aussie and how it affected their lives.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Peter Butt, Bee Reynolds, Will Davies and Look Television Productions
